section.title: Review -- Weighted Averages
section.p: Weighted averages are common in finance as well as actuarial science. Our first version of duration, a measurement of interest rate risk, will be a weighted average. You will see many more.

statement.p: Cobra Kai Dojos Inc. has issued the following quarterly dividends per share over the past two and a half years:
Find a shortcut to calculate the average quarterly dividend per share.
For a set of values t_i, i = 1, \ldots, n, the weighted average of the values with weights \omega_i is: \sum_{i = 1}^n \omega_i t_i where \sum \omega_i = 1.
If you calculate the average quarterly dividend per share of Cobra Kai using a weighted average, what were the weights and what did they represent?
Danny LaRusso has a portfolio with three investments. The investment values and most recently quarterly gain/loss are:

li.p: Investment A: Value is 15,000, quarterly loss of 150
Investment B: Value is 22,500, quarterly gain of 275
Investment C: Value is 12,500, quarterly gain of 450

statement.p: Find the average gain/loss, weighted by value relative to the portfolio.

introduction.p: The cost of capital is the return an investor demands in order to invest. For equity investors, the equity cost of capital is denoted r_E while for debt, the debt cost of capital (think of as the interest rate demanded) is denoted r_D.
If a firm has equity E and debt D, the total value of the firm is D + E and the weighted average cost of capital is:
Note that the value of D+E is the total value of the firm's assets according to the fundamental accounting equation.

task.p: Miyagi Do Karate has debt of D = 15000 and equity of E = 30000. They face a debt cost of capital of r_D = 2.25\% and an equity cost of capital of r_E = 6\%. Find the weighted-average cost of capital.
